content: duet by kristen finlay a simple colourblock top that provides a canvas for displaying two of your favorite colours duet is knit from the top down with a relaxed fit and minimal finishing the main star of this top is your own duet of colours finished measurements 36 40 44 48 52 56 60 64 68 91 5 101 5 112 122 132 142 152 5 162 5 173 cm circumference at bust sample size is 40 101 5cm shown on a bust size of 34 86cm yarn skein journey 100% superfine alpaca 400 yards 366 meters in 100g cc1 1 1 2 2 2 2 2 3 3 cc2 1 1 2 2 2 3 3 3 3 sample colourways cc1 dusk pale mauve and cc2 retro rose dark rose or pattern notes pirate purl blackbeard duet was originally inspired by yarn 90% polwarth 10% silk purchased from katrina of pirate purl 404 yards 370 meters in 100g yarns the idea was to keep the design cc1 1 1 2 2 2 2 2 3 3 minimal to show off the two beautiful cc2 1 1 2 2 2 3 3 3 3 neutral shades i then knit a second sample colourways cc1 hard candy version with our journey yarn using two collection shade #18 pale neutral and of my favorite shades mauve and rose a cc2 coal dark grey duet of colour yarns and dyers have all needles combined to create this design 4mm us 6 duet features a drop-shoulder shape 3 5mm us 4 for rib meaning the shoulders extend down the other arm to form part of the sleeve as the stitch holders stitch markers removable sizes increase so does the length of the markers and tapestry needle drop shoulder this is why sleeve lengths are smaller for the larger sizes to get an gauge indication of how much arm coverage 22 5 sts and 32 row to 4 10 cm in there will be for your size use the center stockinette stitch on larger needles neck to sleeve cuff measurment shown in the schematic 2 instructions continue to knit until back measures 7 7 5 8 8 75 9 25 9 75 10 5 11 11 25 / back 17 5 19 20 22 23 5 24 5 26 5 28 with larger needle and cc1 co 92 108 28 5 cm from cast on edge make sure 112 124 136 148 156 168 180 sts you measure along the armhole side and before you begin you will need to place not over the short row with rs facing two removable stitch markers on the cast bobble all sts on edge to mark the neck these will help front you later when you pick up sts for the beginning at the cast on edge and starting front from the first st on your needle at the right shoulder with rs facing pu count 25 32 33 38 43 48 52 57 62 and k 25
